Articles.Content:
<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IebideOMU2M?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Please feel free to leave a comment on the video as well as here!

It looks OK but in the stock KSP souposhpere anything can fly.

No offence, if you need two additional reaction wheels to keep it stable it doesn't deserve to fly.
The two Reaction wheels aren't needed to fly it just helps it turn faster.

> 
> It looks OK but in the stock KSP souposhpere anything can fly.
> No offence, if you need two additional reaction wheels to keep it stable it doesn't deserve to fly.

Good thing you're not a rocket scientist, we'd never have satellites.
Reminds me of a mix between a V-1 and a SU-47

> 
> Reminds me of a mix between a V-1 and a SU-47

 Thanks I tried to make a plane where all wings were forward-swept. And it still flies in 1.0.2
what recording software do you use?

> 
> It looks OK but in the stock KSP souposhpere anything can fly.
> No offence, if you need two additional reaction wheels to keep it stable it doesn't deserve to fly.

Wow, little harsh don't ya think? We are all here to spitball ideas for a game we all love. Shooting each other down really isn't helpful. Besides if reaction wheel count is proof of undeserved success. Then my 240+ part Osprey with 8 reaction wheels should be scrapped?

> 
> what recording software do you use?

Fraps

> 
> Wow, little harsh don't ya think? We are all here to spitball ideas for a game we all love. Shooting each other down really isn't helpful. Besides if reaction wheel count is proof of undeserved success. Then my 240+ part Osprey with 8 reaction wheels should be scrapped?

True.
